p: Basin hammocks are located behind the coastline, the tidal influence is indirect and lower compared to the fringe hammocks. This community can be monospecific or a mixed species forest of Avicennia germinans, if salinity is high, and Laguncularia racemosa, if salinity is relatively low [ 41]. On the other hand, fringe hammocks are mainly located on the coastline and in coastal lagoons. This type of hammock is influenced by astronomical tides with semidiurnal trends with a maximum value of +0.49 m and a minimum of -0.72 m a.s.l. [ 47], so they are flooded and dried practically every day. In addition, they are exposed to winds and waves of up to 0.5 m, which can increase to more than 2.0 m during storms [ 47, 48]. The dominant species is Rizophora mangle [ 41]. Some of the hammocks (mixed hammocks) could not be distinguished from basin and fringe hammocks; in this case, hammocks could be influenced both by winds and tides, but their impact is lower than in the fringe hammocks.
